picocli

Interface CommandLine.IFactory

  • Enclosing class:
    CommandLine

    public static interface CommandLine.IFactory
    Factory for instantiating classes that are registered declaratively with annotation attributes, like CommandLine.Command.subcommands(), CommandLine.Option.converter(), CommandLine.Parameters.converter() and CommandLine.Command.versionProvider().

    The default factory implementation simply creates a new instance of the specified class when create(Class) is invoked.

    You may provide a custom implementation of this interface. For example, a custom factory implementation could delegate to a dependency injection container that provides the requested instance.

    Since:
    2.2
    See Also:
    CommandLine.CommandLine(Object, IFactory), CommandLine.call(Class, IFactory, PrintStream, PrintStream, Help.Ansi, String...), CommandLine.run(Class, IFactory, PrintStream, PrintStream, Help.Ansi, String...)

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      <K> K create(java.lang.Class<K> cls)
      Returns an instance of the specified class.

      throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an instance of the specified class.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an exception detailing what went wrong when creating or obtaining the instance
